body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

To use openmp with cython one needs to add specific compile flags as described here:
https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/userguide/parallelism.html#compiling

To be able to do that with different compilers/os ,one needs to implement some logic to determine the correct flags.

### Describe the solution you'd like.

The [extension-helpers](https://github.com/astropy/extension-helpers/) module for astropy does exactly that.

I think it would be a nice feature to have some helper functions directly in cython to use in a `setup.py` like done here:
https://extension-helpers.readthedocs.io/en/latest/openmp.html

### Describe alternatives you've considered.

_No response_

### Additional context

I usually use an environment variable to determine if the compilation should use openmp or not:
https://github.com/GeoStat-Framework/GSTools/blob/f60f2cb9e72593a774ea2c2118ecbdb39c566165/setup.py#L20

Mostly due to the fact that wheels shouldn't include openmp libraries, so they should not be compiled with openmp support by default.
title: [ENH] OpenMP flag helpers from Astropys extension-helpers
